FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facilty.
This facility complies with OSHA(29CFR 1910.111) and ASTM Standards for storage and transfer to farm application tanks for anhydrous ammonia. It is the company policy to adhere to all applicable state, federal, and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to adhere to all applicable state, federal, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Clayton County LEPC and Monona Fire Department and respond to the emergency. 
A description of your facility and the regulated substance handled. 
This facility is retail supplier of anhydrous ammonia to farmers. Storage of anhydrous ammonia is all year at this facility. Primary transfer of anhydrous ammonia to farm nurse tanks is done in the Spring and in the Fall. Storage consists of one 30000 gallon tank. Tranfer is accomplished with hoses, valves, and related equipment.
The worst-case scenario. 
Our worst-case scenario is failure of the 30000 gallon storage  tank when filled to greatest amount allowed , resulting in a vapor cloud floating over ground until dispersed. According ot EPA's RMP COMP tables, the distance to end-pooint is 6.9 miles. The total population would be 3087 people involved with the release also involved are businesses, industry, and schools in the affected areas.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specfic prevention steps.
This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all state and local codes and regulations. 
The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained according to OSHA, federal, state, and local regulations. 
Five-year accident history.
The United Cooperative Association has not had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or enviromental damage, or sheltering in place. 
The Emergency Response Program.
In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous system, i

t is our policy to notify the Monona Fire Department and the Clayton County LEPC and request they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the fire department and local LEPC as to handiling of a leak of anhydrous ammonia and the actions to be taken.
Planned changes to improve safety.
None planned at present.
